info.title: JoliGEN server
info.description:
*commit:* [7da45e71](https://github.com/jolibrain/joliGEN/commit/7da45e715eb55e530dd8433d9de18b2340ae6de8)

This is the JoliGEN server API documentation.

get.summary: Get the status of a training process

post.summary: Start a training process with given name.
post.description: The training process will be created using the same options as command line

delete.description: If the process is running, it will be stopped.

get.summary: Get the status of all training processes

post.description: The inference process will be created using the same options as command line

delete.summary: Delete a file or a directory in the filesystem
delete.description: This endpoint can be dangerous, use it with extreme caution

dataroot.description: path to images (should have subfolders trainA, trainB, valA, valB, etc)

gpu_ids.description: gpu ids: e.g. 0  0,1,2, 0,2. use -1 for CPU

name.description: name of the experiment. It decides where to store samples and models

suffix.description: customized suffix: opt.name = opt.name + suffix: e.g., {model}_{netG}_size{load_size}

with_amp.description: whether to activate torch amp on forward passes

with_tf32.description: whether to activate tf32 for faster computations (Ampere GPU and beyond only)

with_torch_compile.description: whether to activate torch.compile for some forward and backward functions (experimental)

dropout.description: whether to use dropout in the discriminator

ndf.description: \# of discrim filters in the first conv layer

netDs.description: specify discriminator architecture, another option, --D_n_layers allows you to specify the layers in the n_layers discriminator. NB: duplicated arguments are ignored. Values: basic, n_layers, pixel, projected_d, temporal, vision_aided, depth, mask, sam

no_antialias.description: if specified, use stride=2 convs instead of antialiased-downsampling (sad)

no_antialias_up.description: if specified, use [upconv(learned filter)] instead of [upconv(hard-coded [1,3,3,1] filter), conv]

norm.description: instance normalization or batch normalization for D

proj_interp.description: whether to force projected discriminator interpolation to a value \> 224, -1 means no interpolation

spectral.description: whether to use spectral norm in the discriminator

temporal_every.description: apply temporal discriminator every x steps

vision_aided_backbones.description: specify vision aided discriminators architectures, they are frozen then output are combined and fitted with a linear network on top, choose from dino, clip, swin, det_coco, seg_ade and combine them with +

weight_sam.description: path to sam weight for D, e.g. models/configs/sam/pretrain/sam_vit_b_01ec64.pth, or models/configs/sam/pretrain/mobile_sam.pt for MobileSAM

attn_nb_mask_attn.description: number of attention masks in _attn model architectures

attn_nb_mask_input.description: number of mask dedicated to input in _attn model architectures

backward_compatibility_twice_resnet_bloc.description: if true, feats will go througt resnet blocks two times for resnet_attn generators. This option will be deleted, it's for backward compatibility (old models were trained that way).

config_segformer.description: path to segformer configuration file for G

diff_n_timestep_test.description: Number of timesteps used for UNET mha inference (test time).

diff_n_timestep_train.description: Number of timesteps used for UNET mha training.

hdit_depths.description: distribution of depth blocks across the HDiT stages, should have same size as --G_hdit_widths

hdit_patch_size.description: Patch size for HDIT, e.g. 4 for 4x4 patches

hdit_widths.description: width multiplier for each level of the HDiT

nblocks.description: \# of layer blocks in G, applicable to resnets

ngf.description: \# of gen filters in the last conv layer

norm.description: instance normalization or batch normalization for G

padding_type.description: whether to use padding in the generator

spectral.description: whether to use spectral norm in the generator

unet_mha_attn_res.description: downrate samples at which attention takes place

unet_mha_channel_mults.description: channel multiplier for each level of the UNET mha

unet_mha_num_head_channels.description: number of channels in each head of the mha architecture

unet_mha_num_heads.description: number of heads in the mha architecture

unet_mha_res_blocks.description: distribution of resnet blocks across the UNet stages, should have same size as --G_unet_mha_channel_mults

unet_mha_vit_efficient.description: if true, use efficient attention in UNet and UViT

uvit_num_transformer_blocks.description: Number of transformer blocks in UViT

cm_num_steps.description: number of steps before reaching the fully discretized consistency model sampling schedule

diffusion_cond_computed_sketch_list.description: what primitives to use for random sketch

diffusion_cond_embed.description: whether to use conditioning embeddings to the generator layers, and what type

diffusion_cond_embed_dim.description: nb of examples processed for inference

diffusion_cond_image_creation.description: how image conditioning is created: either from y_t (no conditioning), previous frame, from computed sketch (e.g. canny), from low res image or from reference image (i.e. image that is not aligned with the ground truth)

diffusion_cond_prob_use_previous_frame.description: prob to use previous frame as y cond

diffusion_cond_sam_crop_delta.description: extend crop's width and height by 2\*crop_delta before computing masks

diffusion_cond_sam_final_canny.description: whether to perform a Canny edge detection on sam sketch to soften the edges

diffusion_cond_sam_max_mask_area.description: maximum area in proportion of image size for a mask to be kept

diffusion_cond_sam_min_mask_area.description: minimum area in proportion of image size for a mask to be kept

diffusion_cond_sam_no_output_binary_sam.description: whether to not output binary sketch before Canny

diffusion_cond_sam_no_sample_points_in_e.description: whether to not sample the points inside an ellipse to avoid the corners of the image

diffusion_cond_sam_no_sobel_filter.description: whether to not use a Sobel filter on each SAM masks

diffusion_cond_sam_points_per_side.description: number of points per side of image to prompt SAM with (\# of prompted points will be points_per_side\*\*2)

diffusion_cond_sam_redundancy_threshold.description: redundancy threshold above which redundant masks are not kept

diffusion_cond_sam_sobel_threshold.description: sobel threshold in %% of gradient magnitude

diffusion_cond_sam_use_gaussian_filter.description: whether to apply a Gaussian blur to each SAM masks

diffusion_cond_sketch_canny_range.description: range of randomized canny sketch thresholds

diffusion_generate_per_class.description: whether to generate samples of each images

diffusion_ref_embed_net.description: embedding network to use for ref conditioning

diffusion_task.description: Whether to perform inpainting, super resolution or pix2pix

MSE_idt.description: use MSENCE loss for identity mapping: MSE(G(Y), Y))

flip_equivariance.description: Enforce flip-equivariance as additional regularization. It's used by FastCUT, but not CUT

lambda_MSE_idt.description: weight for MSE identity loss: MSE(G(X), X)

lambda_NCE.description: weight for NCE loss: NCE(G(X), X)

lambda_SRC.description: weight for SRC (semantic relation consistency) loss: NCE(G(X), X)

nce_idt.description: use NCE loss for identity mapping: NCE(G(Y), Y))

nce_includes_all_negatives_from_minibatc.description: (used for single image translation) If True, include the negatives from the other samples of the minibatch when computing the contrastive loss. Please see models/patchnce.py for more details.

nce_layers.description: compute NCE loss on which layers

netF.description: how to downsample the feature map

netF_dropout.description: whether to use dropout with F

netF_norm.description: instance normalization or batch normalization for F

lambda_A.description: weight for cycle loss (A -\> B -\> A)

lambda_B.description: weight for cycle loss (B -\> A -\> B)

lambda_identity.description: use identity mapping. Setting lambda_identity other than 0 has an effect of scaling the weight of the identity mapping loss. For example, if the weight of the identity loss should be 10 times smaller than the weight of the reconstruction loss, please set lambda_identity = 0.1

rec_noise.description: whether to add noise to reconstruction

P_lr.description: initial learning rate for P networks

adversarial_loss_p.description: if True, also train the prediction model with an adversarial loss

no_train_P_fake_images.description: if True, P wont be trained over fake images projections

projection_threshold.description: threshold of the real images projection loss below with fake projection and fake reconstruction losses are applied

ddim_num_steps.description: number of steps for ddim sampling

loss.description: loss type of the denoising model

sampling_method.description: choose the sampling method between ddpm and ddim

image_bits.description: number of bits of the image (e.g. 8, 12 or 16)

inverted_mask.description: whether to invert the mask, i.e. around the bbox

max_dataset_size.description: Maximum number of samples allowed per dataset. If the dataset directory contains more than max_dataset_size, only a subset is loaded.

online_context_pixels.description: context pixel band around the crop, unused for generation, only for disc

online_fixed_mask_size.description: if \>0, it will be used as fixed bbox size (warning: in dataset resolution ie before resizing)

online_random_bbox.description: whether to randomly sample a bbox per online crop

online_select_category.description: category to select for bounding boxes, -1 means all boxes selected

online_single_bbox.description: whether to only allow a single bbox per online crop

preprocess.description: scaling and cropping of images at load time

refined_mask.description: whether to use refined mask with sam

relative_paths.description: whether paths to images are relative to dataroot

sanitize_paths.description: if true, wrong images or labels paths will be removed before training

serial_batches.description: if true, takes images in order to make batches, otherwise takes them randomly

temporal_frame_step.description: how many frames between successive frames selected

temporal_num_common_char.description: how many characters (the first ones) are used to identify a video; if =-1 natural sorting is used

temporal_number_frames.description: how many successive frames use for temporal loader

color_mask_A.description: Perform task of replacing color-filled masks by objects

crop_delta_A.description: size of crops are random, values allowed are online_creation_crop_size more or less online_creation_crop_delta for domain A

crop_delta_B.description: size of crops are random, values allowed are online_creation_crop_size more or less online_creation_crop_delta for domain B

crop_size_A.description: crop to this size during online creation, it needs to be greater than bbox size for domain A

crop_size_B.description: crop to this size during online creation, it needs to be greater than bbox size for domain B

load_size_A.description: load to this size during online creation, format : width height or only one size if square

load_size_B.description: load to this size during online creation, format : width height or only one size if square

mask_delta_A.description: mask offset (in pixels) to allow generation of a bigger object in domain B (for semantic loss) for domain A, format : 'width (x),height (y)' for each class or only one size if square, e.g. '125, 55 100, 100' for 2 classes

mask_delta_A_ratio.description: ratio mask offset to allow generation of a bigger object in domain B (for semantic loss) for domain A, format : width (x),height (y) for each class or only one size if square

mask_delta_B.description: mask offset (in pixels) to allow generation of a bigger object in domain A (for semantic loss) for domain B, format : 'width (x),height (y)' for each class or only one size if square, e.g. '125, 55 100, 100' for 2 classes

mask_delta_B_ratio.description: ratio mask offset to allow generation of a bigger object in domain A (for semantic loss) for domain B, format : 'width (x),height (y)' for each class or only one size if square

mask_random_offset_A.description: ratio mask size randomization (only to make bigger one) to robustify the image generation in domain A, format : width (x) height (y) or only one size if square

mask_random_offset_B.description: mask size randomization (only to make bigger one) to robustify the image generation in domain B, format : width (y) height (x) or only one size if square

mask_square_A.description: whether masks should be squared for domain A

mask_square_B.description: whether masks should be squared for domain B

rand_mask_A.description: Perform task of replacing noised masks by objects

all_classes_as_one.description: if true, all classes will be considered as the same one (ie foreground vs background)

class_weights.description: class weights for imbalanced semantic classes

config_segformer.description: path to segformer configuration file for f_s

nf.description: \# of filters in the first conv layer of classifier

semantic_nclasses.description: number of classes of the semantic loss classifier

semantic_threshold.description: threshold of the semantic classifier loss below with semantic loss is applied

weight_sam.description: path to sam weight for f_s, e.g. models/configs/sam/pretrain/sam_vit_b_01ec64.pth, or models/configs/sam/pretrain/mobile_sam.pt for MobileSAM

weight_segformer.description: path to segformer weight for f_s, e.g. models/configs/segformer/pretrain/segformer_mit-b0.pth

all_classes_as_one.description: if true, all classes will be considered as the same one (ie foreground vs background)

class_weights.description: class weights for imbalanced semantic classes

config_segformer.description: path to segformer configuration file for cls

nf.description: \# of filters in the first conv layer of classifier

semantic_nclasses.description: number of classes of the semantic loss classifier

semantic_threshold.description: threshold of the semantic classifier loss below with semantic loss is applied

weight_segformer.description: path to segformer weight for cls, e.g. models/configs/segformer/pretrain/segformer_mit-b0.pth

no_html.description: do not save intermediate training results to [opt.checkpoints_dir]/[opt.name]/web/

print_freq.description: frequency of showing training results on console

update_html_freq.description: frequency of saving training results to html

verbose.description: if specified, print more debugging information

aim_port.description: aim port of the web display

aim_server.description: aim server of the web display

diff_fake_real.description: if True x - G(x) is displayed

freq.description: frequency of showing training results on screen

id.description: window id of the web display

ncols.description: if positive, display all images in a single visdom web panel with certain number of images per row.(if == 0 ncols will be computed automatically)

networks.description: Set True if you want to display networks on port 8000

type.description: output display, either visdom, aim or no output

visdom_autostart.description: whether to start a visdom server automatically

visdom_port.description: visdom port of the web display

visdom_server.description: visdom server of the web display

winsize.description: display window size for both visdom and HTML

init_gain.description: scaling factor for normal, xavier and orthogonal.

input_nc.description: \# of input image channels: 3 for RGB and 1 for grayscale

multimodal.description: multimodal model with random latent input vector

output_nc.description: \# of output image channels: 3 for RGB and 1 for grayscale

prior_321_backwardcompatibility.description: whether to load models from previous version of JG.

type_sam.description: which model to use for segment-anything mask generation

D_accuracy_every.description: compute D accuracy every N iterations

G_ema.description: whether to build G via exponential moving average

cls_l1_regression.description: if true l1 loss will be used to compute regressor loss

cls_regression.description: if true cls will be a regressor and not a classifier

compute_D_accuracy.description: whether to compute D accuracy explicitely

compute_metrics_test.description: whether to compute test metrics, e.g. FID, ...

continue.description: continue training: load the latest model

epoch.description: which epoch to load? set to latest to use latest cached model

epoch_count.description: the starting epoch count, we save the model by \<epoch_count\>, \<epoch_count\>+\<save_latest_freq\>, ...

export_jit.description: whether to export model in jit format

feat_wavelet.description: if true, train in wavelet features space (Note: this may not include all discriminators, when training GANs)

gan_mode.description: the type of GAN objective. vanilla GAN loss is the cross-entropy objective used in the original GAN paper.

iter_size.description: backward will be apllied each iter_size iterations, it simulate a greater batch size : its value is batch_size\*iter_size

load_iter.description: which iteration to load? if load_iter \> 0, the code will load models by iter_[load_iter]; otherwise, the code will load models by [epoch]

lr_decay_iters.description: multiply by a gamma every lr_decay_iters iterations

metrics_list.description: metrics on results quality to compute

metrics_save_images.description: whether to save images that result form metrics computation

n_epochs.description: number of epochs with the initial learning rate

n_epochs_decay.description: number of epochs to linearly decay learning rate to zero

nb_img_max_fid.description: Maximum number of samples allowed per dataset to compute fid. If the dataset directory contains more than nb_img_max_fid, only a subset is used.

pool_size.description: the size of image buffer that stores previously generated images

save_epoch_freq.description: frequency of saving checkpoints at the end of epochs

save_latest_freq.description: frequency of saving the latest results

semantic_cls.description: if true semantic class losses will be used

semantic_mask.description: if true semantic mask losses will be used

temporal_criterion.description: if true, MSE loss will be computed between successive frames

temporal_criterion_lambda.description: lambda for MSE loss that will be computed between successive frames

cls_B.description: if true cls will be trained not only on domain A but also on domain B

cls_pretrained.description: whether to use a pretrained model, available for non "basic" model only

cls_template.description: classifier/regressor model type, from torchvision (resnet18, ...), default is custom simple model

idt.description: if true apply semantic loss on identity

net_output.description: if true apply generator semantic loss on network output for real image rather than on label.

use_label_B.description: if true domain B has labels too

compute_miou.description: whether to compute mIoU on semantic masks prediction

disjoint_f_s.description: whether to use a disjoint f_s with the same exact structure

f_s_B.description: if true f_s will be trained not only on domain A but also on domain B

for_removal.description: if true, object removal mode, domain B images with label 0, cut models only

loss_out_mask.description: loss for out mask content (which should not change).

no_train_f_s_A.description: if true f_s wont be trained on domain A

APA.description: if true, G will be used as augmentation during D training adaptively to D overfitting between real and fake images

APA_every.description: How often to perform APA adjustment?

APA_nimg.description: APA adjustment speed, measured in how many images it takes for p to increase/decrease by one unit.

D_diffusion.description: whether to apply diffusion noise augmentation to discriminator inputs, projected discriminator only

D_diffusion_every.description: How often to perform diffusion augmentation adjustment

D_label_smooth.description: whether to use one-sided label smoothing with discriminator

D_noise.description: whether to add instance noise to discriminator inputs

affine.description: if specified, apply random affine transforms to the images for data augmentation

affine_scale_max.description: if random affine specified, max scale range value

affine_scale_min.description: if random affine specified, min scale range value

affine_shear.description: if random affine specified, shear range (0,value)

affine_translate.description: if random affine specified, translation range (-value\*img_size,+value\*img_size) value

diff_aug_policy.description: choose the augmentation policy : color randaffine randperspective. If you want more than one, please write them separated by a comma with no space (e.g. color,randaffine)

flip.description: if specified, flip the images for data augmentation, possible values: none, horizontal, vertical, both

imgaug.description: whether to apply random image augmentation

no_rotate.description: if specified, do not rotate the images for data augmentation

sync.title: Sync
sync.description: if false, the call returns immediately and train process is executed in the background. If true, the call returns only when training process is finished

sync.title: Sync
sync.description: if false, the call returns immediately and train process is executed in the background. If true, the call returns only when training process is finished
